checker square scarf purl according to the pattern so the squares remain consistent the stitch pattern is shown in the figure it is shown as rs and the black dots represent knit sts step 3 knitting to desired length measure the length of your increase section and knit according the pattern until your desired total length minus that measurement for example if your increase section measures 15 cm continue knitting until your piece is desired length 15 cm step 4 decreasing row1 rs edge sts knit according the patten double_crochet edge sts row2 ws edge sts knit according the patten edge sts row3 rs same as row2 row4 ws same as row2 row5 rs edge sts double_crochet knit according the patten edge sts row6 ws same as row2 row7 rs same as row2 row8 ws same as row2 continue decreasing before the last edge sts and after the first edge sts on every decrease row in other words repeat row1 8 which decrease a total of 2sts per full repeat until only edge sts plus 1st i e 5sts left on the needles the last row should be on the ws and work on the following row row1 rs edge sts slip 2sts purl wise with yarn held in the front k row2 ws edge sts for total 2 times row3 rs edge sts for total 2 times 4 pattern - checker square scarf cut the yarn then use a tapestry needle to thread through all remaining sts on the dpns at once finish weave in all ends wash and block feel free to share your #checker_square_scarf on instagram this pattern is for private use only and may not be copied sold or in other ways distributed instagram @hannah_knit_ hannah chen i 2026 5
